definition: to bring/to fetch/to get
to hold/to seize/to catch/to apprehend/to take/(used in the same way as 把[ba3]: to mark the following noun as a direct object)
old variant of 拿[na2]
variant of 拿[na2]
to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next
the attitude of mechanically borrowing (ideas etc)

sentences.english: some drink from the fountain of knowledge, but he just gargled.
sentences.chinese: 人家畅饮智慧之泉，他只是拿来漱口了。

sentences.english: ''O.K., O.K., I'll get back your cellphone, '' I told her through the door.
sentences.chinese: “好，好，我会把你的手机拿来，”我隔着门跟她说。

sentences.english: Can you use them for a swatter?
sentences.chinese: 你的耳朵可以拿来当苍蝇拍吗？

sentences.english: Tilly brought it, and he put it on her.
sentences.chinese: 蒂莉拿来睡衣，他给她穿上。

sentences.english: The stewardess kindly brought me a blanket.
sentences.chinese: 女乘务员体贴地给我拿来了毯子。

sentences.english: It is the same kind of grass that one of the children gave Siddhartha to use as a cushion to sit on.
sentences.chinese: 那是一个孩子拿来给悉达多当坐垫的草。
你拿来那张一百万英镑的钞票了吗？

sentences.english: This did not yet tempt them to adventures staking Soviet assets.
sentences.chinese: 这还没有促使他们把苏联的老本拿来孤注一掷。

sentences.english: If this shirt doesn’t fit, may I return it later?
sentences.chinese: 如果不合身，我能拿来退换吗？

sentences.english: He went and fetched his pneumatic drill and smashed the house down.
sentences.chinese: 他拿来了气泵钻，三下两下，就把房子给钻塌了。

sentences.english: They brought salad and placed it in front of Julia.
sentences.chinese: 仆人们拿来了莎拉，放在了茱莉亚的面前。

sentences.english: Fame is just like a pancake drawn on the wall. You cannot eat it.
sentences.chinese: 名声就像画在墙上的饼，不可以拿来吃。

sentences.english: Paul took some  fishing rods, and they all went down to the  brook to fish.
sentences.chinese: 保罗拿来一些钓鱼竿，他们都去小溪边钓鱼。

sentences.english: Worried your employer might cut your position in a downturn?
sentences.chinese: 担心在不景气的时候第一个被拿来开刀吗？

sentences.english: These big games shouldn't be about giving refs experience.
sentences.chinese: 这些大赛不应该拿来给裁判增加经验。

sentences.english: I better get the sack and put it over my shoulders.
sentences.chinese: 我还是把布袋拿来披在肩膀上吧。

definition: to be used for
to treat as/to regard as/to look upon as
to hold/to seize/to catch/to apprehend/to take/(used in the same way as 把[ba3]: to mark the following noun as a direct object)
old variant of 拿[na2]
variant of 拿[na2]
to treat as/to regard as
to consider as/to take to be
to throw away/to throw out
and so on/and such
to use/to employ/to have to/to eat or drink/expense or outlay/usefulness/hence/therefore
to take out/to put out/to provide/to put forward (a proposal)/to come up with (evidence)
to play a joke/to make fun of/to joke
as one wishes/as one pleases/at random/negligent/casual/wanton
easily/without trouble/while one is at it/in passing/handy
to exchange (sth) for (sth else)/to replace with/to convert into
conveniently/without extra trouble/while doing it/in passing
to throw/to throw away
conveniently/in passing/without much extra effort
